result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:53 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Matthew Dobbe in court for Brian James St Sauver. Defendant Brian James St Sauver in court. Set for Plea. Court reviews case. ADA Smestad states Atty Dobbe requested possible different resolution and ADA Smestad has victim rights to comply with. Atty Dobbe requests to set JT for further negotiations. Court sets JT and FPT. Unusual MIL due by 02/03/23. Witness list due by 03/01/23. Adjourned 04:10 PM

8:46 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brian James St Sauver in court.  Attorney Matthew Dobbe in court for Brian James St Sauver. Erin of VW appeared. Court reviews file. ADA Smestad requests time to extend new offer to Defendant. 9:01 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brian James St Sauver in court.  Attorney Matthew Dobbe appeared by video for Brian James St Sauver. Court reviews file. Atty Dobbe verified with Restorative Justice that DE is enrolled in 2 classes and completed 1. Atty Dobbe to send verification to JA. Atty Dobbe states no resolution at this time. ADA Becker states ADA Smestad has notes that case is heading towards resolution and requests time to allow resolution. Next hearing date previously set. Adjourned at 9:05 AM.  gll
Scheduling Order. Signed by EFV on 06/03/22. arc

Status conference on June 30, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Status conference on August 16, 2022 at 08:45 am.

- No possession of firearms.

- Defendant must participate in DV assessment recommendations and follow through without being discharged without successful completion of programing.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, J.S.S., L.B. and A.B..  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. 

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

01:06 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Brian Thomas Smestad, DF ATTY: Matthew Dobbe, DF: Brian James St Sauver appeared. Victim witness appeared with victim. Court reviews case. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Enters NG Plea on all counts. reserve on all pre-plea rights. Waives Speedy trial. Atty Dobbe notes DE has completed a DV assessment and going to start programming. Court sets STC.  Atty Dobbe requests bond modification. ADA Smestad does not take position on bond modification. Court Amends bond. Court request written verification DE is participating in programming. Court confirms address and phone number. Adjourned 01:18 pm  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:45 am.  Status conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:45 am.

11:48 AM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Melstrom, Clerk: Lindabaur. ADA:  Brian Thomas Smestad   DF ATTY:  Matthew Dobbe   DF:  Brian James St Sauver appeared. ADA Smestad calls Deputy Garrett Kiser of SCSO. S/T Deputy Kiser. Direct by ADA Smestad. Deputy identifies Defendant. Cross by Atty Dobbe. Redirect by ADA Smestad. Recross by Atty Dobbe. Witness excused. Closing arguments. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Atty Dobbe requests to modify bond to allow contact with victim. ADA Smestad takes no position on modification. Court questions Atty Dobbe. Court denies at this time, but will reconsider after seeing DV score. Court sets Arraignment. Defendant confirms address and phone number. Adjourned at 12:18 PM.  gll  Arraignment scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Status conference on May 5, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

- Defendant allowed 1 time back to residence to retrieve belongings with law enforcement. 

- No possession of firearms.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  J.S.S or residence other than Via text/ email regarding Children and financials (3rd party to facilitate children exchanges), L.B and A. B or residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
